Requesting various documents, records, and materials from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) pertaining to the release genetically engineered modified bees in the United States. 1.) All documents, records and materials relating in any way to Investigational New Animal Drug (INAD) file maintained by the USDA, including, but not limited to, results of any investigations conducted under INAD; 2.) All documents, records, and materials submitted in support of and/or related to genetically engineered or modified bees under the New Animal Drug Applications (NADA), including all application amendments and updates. This request encompasses, but is not limited to the following: a. All documents, records and materials concerning the articles used as a components of genetically engineered or modified bees, and the composition and the molecular characterization of the rDNA construct of the bee(s). b. All documents, records and materials concerning the method used in, and the facilities and controls used for the, containment and release of genetically engineered or modified bees, including, but not limited to plans and schematics for containment and release; c. Information concerning any samples of genetically engineered or modified bees and its rDNA construct; and d. All documents, records and materials concerning environmental analyses of potential individual and cumulative environmental effects, risks, and impacts associated with the release, escape or disposal of genetically engineered or modified bees, including but not limited to, all documents related to the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA), The Federal, Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FFDCA), and an Environmental Assessment or Environmental Impact Statement created pursuant to 21 C.F.R. § § 25, 514 and 42 U.S.C. § 4321 et seq; 3.) All documents, records, and materials (including inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence) related to the human health and environmental safety of genetically engineered or modified bees including, but not limited to potential adverse outcome; 4.) All documents, records, and materials reflecting communication, including inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence between USDA and any other federal or state governmental agency or official concerning genetically engineered or modified bees; 5.) All documents, records, and materials reflecting communications between the USDA and other foreign governmental agency or official, including but not limited to officials of Austria concerning the field release of genetically engineered or modified bees; 6.) All documents, records, and materials reflecting communication including, inter-agency studies, memoranda and correspondence, between the USDA and companies concerning genetically engineered or modified bees; and 7.) All documents, records, and materials indicating a plan or proposal to release genetically engineered or modified bees in any U.S. state or U.S. territory.
